problem_text:
14.50. (Z. I. Borevich). A subgroup A of a group G is said to be paranormal (respec-
tively, polynormal) if Ax ⩽ ⟨Au | u ∈ ⟨A, Ax⟩⟩⟩ (respectively, Ax ⩽ Au | u ∈ A⟨x⟩) for any x ∈ G. Is every polynormal subgroup of a finite group paranormal?
A. S. Kondratiev
answer: Not always (V. I. Mysovskikh, Dokl. Math., 60 (1999), 71–72).
